title: International Ovarian Tumor Analysis (IOTA) Simple Rules Risk Assessment
description: Predicts risk of malignancy in adnexal masses using ultrasonographic features. The IOTA Simple Rules use 10 ultrasound features (5 benign B-rules and 5 malignant M-rules) to classify ovarian masses as benign, malignant, or inconclusive. This classification system achieves 86.8% sensitivity, 95.6% specificity, and 92.3% accuracy in distinguishing benign from malignant ovarian tumors. The rules are designed for preoperative evaluation of persistent adnexal masses in women considered for surgery, excluding classical masses with pathognomonic features (corpus luteum, endometrioma, dermoid cyst).

parameters.name: unilocular_cyst
parameters.description: B1 - Unilocular cyst (single chamber with smooth wall)

parameters.name: solid_components_small
parameters.description: B2 - Solid components <7mm in largest diameter

parameters.name: acoustic_shadows
parameters.description: B3 - Acoustic shadows (hyperechoic areas with shadowing suggesting calcifications or fat)

parameters.name: smooth_multilocular_small
parameters.description: B4 - Smooth multilocular tumor <100mm in largest diameter

parameters.name: no_blood_flow
parameters.description: B5 - No blood flow on color Doppler (color score 1)

parameters.name: irregular_solid_tumor
parameters.description: M1 - Irregular solid tumor (completely solid mass with irregular outline)

parameters.name: ascites
parameters.description: M2 - Ascites (free fluid in the abdomen)

parameters.name: papillary_structures
parameters.description: M3 - At least 4 papillary structures (solid projections into cystic cavity)

parameters.name: irregular_multilocular_large
parameters.description: M4 - Irregular multilocular solid tumor with largest diameter ≥100mm

parameters.name: strong_blood_flow
parameters.description: M5 - Very strong blood flow on color Doppler (color score 4)

result.name: risk_classification
result.description: IOTA Simple Rules risk classification (Benign, Malignant, or Inconclusive)

ranges.description: One or more B-features present, no M-features
ranges.interpretation: Low risk of malignancy. Mass classified as benign based on IOTA Simple Rules. Consider routine gynecologic follow-up. Surgery may be considered for symptomatic masses or patient preference.

ranges.description: One or more M-features present, no B-features
ranges.interpretation: High risk of malignancy. Mass classified as malignant based on IOTA Simple Rules. Immediate referral to gynecologic oncology for comprehensive staging and management. Consider tumor markers (CA-125, HE4) and CT/MRI for surgical planning.

ranges.description: Both B-features and M-features present, or no features present
ranges.interpretation: Cannot be classified using Simple Rules (10-20% of cases). Consider additional diagnostic methods: subjective assessment by expert sonographer, IOTA ADNEX model, magnetic resonance imaging, or tumor markers. Multidisciplinary team discussion recommended.

references: Timmerman D, Testa AC, Bourne T, et al. Logistic regression model to distinguish between the benign and malignant adnexal mass before surgery: a multicenter study by the International Ovarian Tumor Analysis Group. J Clin Oncol. 2005 Dec 1;23(34):8794-801. doi: 10.1200/JCO.2005.01.7632.

Timmerman D, Ameye L, Fischerova D, et al. Simple ultrasound rules to distinguish between benign and malignant adnexal masses before surgery: prospective validation study. BMJ. 2010 Dec 14;341:c6839. doi: 10.1136/bmj.c6839.
Nunes N, Ambler G, Foo X, et al. Use of IOTA simple rules for diagnosis of ovarian cancer: meta-analysis. Ultrasound Obstet Gynecol. 2014 Nov;44(5):503-14. doi: 10.1002/uog.13437.
formula: If B-features present AND no M-features → Benign; If M-features present AND no B-features → Malignant; If both present OR neither present → Inconclusive
notes: The IOTA Simple Rules achieved 86.8% sensitivity, 95.6% specificity, and 92.3% accuracy
Successfully classifies 76-80% of adnexal masses, with 10-20% remaining inconclusive
Developed by the International Ovarian Tumor Analysis (IOTA) group from 9 centers in 5 countries
B-features suggest benign etiology: B1 (unilocular cyst), B2 (solid components <7mm), B3 (acoustic shadows), B4 (smooth multilocular <100mm), B5 (no blood flow)
M-features suggest malignant etiology: M1 (irregular solid tumor), M2 (ascites), M3 (≥4 papillary structures), M4 (irregular multilocular ≥100mm), M5 (very strong blood flow)
Rules apply to persistent adnexal masses requiring surgical consideration
Excludes classical masses with pathognomonic features (corpus luteum, endometrioma, dermoid cyst)
Cannot replace proper ultrasound training and experience
Requires good quality ultrasound equipment and technique
For inconclusive cases, consider IOTA ADNEX model, expert subjective assessment, or MRI
Color score 1 = no blood flow, Color score 4 = very strong blood flow
Papillary structures are solid projections into cystic cavity from wall or septum
Multilocular = multiple chambers/compartments separated by septa
Solid components include any solid tissue within the mass
Irregular outline refers to non-smooth, bumpy, or lobulated contours
Acoustic shadows typically seen with calcifications, hair, or fat content
Rules designed for preoperative classification to aid surgical planning
High negative predictive value for benign classification reduces unnecessary oncology referrals
